meanings.definition: The act of delegitimizing or making something appear illegitimate.
meanings.sent1: The delegitimations of the election results caused confusion.
meanings.sent2: The constant delegitimations of the new policy weakened its effectiveness.
meanings.sent3: The delegitimations of the teacher's authority led to chaos in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: Her delegitimations of his achievements were like arrows to his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The delegitimations of the evidence left the case in shambles.

meanings.definition: The process of undermining the legitimacy or authority of something.
meanings.sent1: The slow delegitimations of the government's decisions raised concerns.
meanings.sent2: The delegitimations of the company's leadership created unrest among employees.
meanings.sent3: His constant delegitimations of the rules made him the class clown.
meanings.sent4: The delegitimations of the traditional values shook the community.
meanings.sent5: The delegitimations of the treaty left the nation vulnerable.

meanings.definition: The act of discrediting or invalidating something.
meanings.sent1: Her delegitimations of his work ethic were unfair.
meanings.sent2: The constant delegitimations of the research findings puzzled the scientists.
meanings.sent3: The delegitimations of the weather forecast made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His delegitimations of her achievements were like a dark cloud over her.
meanings.sent5: The delegitimations of the historical facts left many in disbelief.
